doc.field: [Y-1700] Indenture for sale of land on Broadway in lower Manhattan to the Reformed Protestant Dutch Church of the City of New York
[Y-1700] Indenture for sale of land on Broadway in lower Manhattan to the Reformed Protestant Dutch Church of the City of New York

Parchment deed. Land sold by five couples, being the heirs of Pieter Stoutenburgh (1613-1699): Tobias Stoutenburgh (bricklayer) and wife, Antio (or Annetie?); Evort Boyvanko, Esquire and wife, Wyntio; Isaac Stoutenburgh (carpenter) and wife, Noltio; Albortus Ringo (cordwainer) and wife, Jannotio(?); and William Waldron and wife, Engoltio(?). Deed signed with seals by all, with three of the wives using marks. Deed recorded January 22, 1700. Later note on reverse signed by Justice David Provoost and others dated October 29, 1701. Rough typescript and notes from donor are also in the folder. (Gift of Dr. William O'Keefe, October 2019.)
Series I. Individual Oversize Manuscripts >> [Y-1700] Indenture for sale of land on Broadway in lower Manhattan to the Reformed Protestant Dutch Church of the City of New York
